messages.content: What is the purpose of the TextOverlay node in ComfyUI?
The TextOverlay node in ComfyUI allows users to overlay text on images, supporting various adjustments such as font size, type, color, alignment, and position.
Can the TextOverlay node be used for both single and batch image processing?
Yes, the TextOverlay node supports both single and batch processing of images.
How can users install the TextOverlay node in ComfyUI?

Users can install the TextOverlay node by cloning the repository into the `custom_nodes` directory of their ComfyUI installation using the command: `git clone https://github.com/Munkyfoot/ComfyUI-TextOverlay`.
What should users do to use a custom font with the TextOverlay node?

To use a custom font, users should ensure the font file is included in the `fonts` directory within the TextOverlay directory. They can then specify the font file name in the `font` parameter of the node.
What happens if the specified font file is not found in the TextOverlay node?
If the specified font file is not found, the TextOverlay node will default to a system-installed font.
What are the options for horizontal and vertical text alignment in the TextOverlay node?
For horizontal alignment, users can choose from `left`, `center`, or `right`. For vertical alignment, the options are `top`, `middle`, or `bottom`.
What is the output of the TextOverlay node?
The output of the TextOverlay node is the modified input image(s) with the specified text overlaid according to the configured parameters.
